intro: Hieracium divisum subsp. pollichiae, commonly known as the Pollich's divided hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers and is native to Central Europe. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are divided into narrow segments, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a perennial species that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
